sense.name: a quantity that is an approximate calculation
sense.examples: The estimates for annual yields at the chip fabrication plant turned out to be quite accurate. My first estimate was off by an order of magnitude. Bob's estimate of an hour to drive to the beach was based on low traffic times.

sense.name: a judgement or opinion about something
sense.examples: Professor Smith's estimate of the freshman chemistry class is rather low. Our estimate of John rose dramatically after he got an article accepted to Nature. Their estimate of their government's honesty in these matters is not great.

sense.name: an official document appraising the value of something
sense.examples: The last estimate on that home showed annual property taxes of three thousand dollars. Bob does real estate estimates for three towns in our county. My house has gone through two estimates since I bought it.

sense.name: an informal document indicating the approximate cost of something
sense.examples: Bob got three different estimates from three different painting companies. Mary left her car with the auto shop after she had seen their estimate for repairs. I left the estimate for the kitchen renovations on the dining room table for you.
